description: 1670s, log +‎ book, originally a record of a ship’s speed and progress, from a wooden float (chip log, or simply log) used to measure speed.

entries.meaning: (nautical) A book in which measurements from the ship's log are recorded, along with other salient details of the voyage.
(by extension) A book in which events are recorded; a journal, especially of travel.
(UK) A record of the ownership, and licensing of a motor car
